Package Controllers

Class GSA_EditorController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.GSA_EditorController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GSA_EditorController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Created class GSA_AuthorController.java

This class controls the customer screen for the application.

Author:
Jamie Barbour-Moore

      protected void DeleteEditorClicked() throws SQLException
      This method deletes the selected customer if the user clicks to confirm.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the database access fails

    • BackClicked

      protected void BackClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method goes back to the home screen if the user clicks to confirm.

      event - the action that triggered the method
      Throws:
      IOException - if load fails

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      This method initializes the customers screen. It adds all the customers in the system to the display table.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - the url
      resources - the resource bundle

    • fillInDropDowns

      private void fillInDropDowns() throws SQLException
      This method fills in the information for the region and country dropdowns. It adds all the countries and first level divisions to the appropriate dropdowns. This method also uses the 2 lambda expressions.

      The first lambda replaces a for loop to create a list of all the country names. The second lambda replaces a for loop to create a list of all the first level divisions.

      Throws:
      SQLException - if it fails to get all countries or first level divisions

    • updateDivisionsByCountry

      private void updateDivisionsByCountry() throws SQLException
      This method updates the first level divisions in the dropdown to only be the ones which correspond to the country selected.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the database access fails

    • getNewID

      private int getNewID()
      This method generates the next available id for the new editor.
      Returns:
      int of the next available id

    • personSelected

      void personSelected()
      This method sets the data fields when the table is clicked on.

    • isDataValid

      private boolean isDataValid()
      This method checks if the customer information in the form is valid.
      Returns:
      a boolean which is true if the information is valid

    • getEditorFromForm

      private Person getEditorFromForm(int editorID) throws SQLException
      This method creates an editor Person from the data currently in the form.
      Parameters:
      editorID - The id of the author.
      Returns:
      the author object
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the database access fails

    • unselect

      public void unselect()
      This method unselects anything from the Customer Table

      public void searchClicked() throws SQLException

      Throws:
